item.title: SRSxLLM
item.description: Spaced repetition software (SRS) offers a powerful and simple way to reinforce learning but it takes time and energy to create questions to review, sometimes up to 2-3x longer than just reading the content itself.

item.title: Correspondent Banking
item.description: How is one money sent from one person to the next? The answer, it depends. It depends on whether the person you are sending money to banked at the same place as you? References § A Simple Explanation of How Money Moves Around the Banking System.

item.title: § Climate & Energy
item.description: Reading in progress! Whole Earth Discipline .

item.title: § Payments
item.description: We take sending and receiving money for granted. After all, we just have to open Zelle, tap “send”, and money magically enters someone else’s account.

item.title: § Internet & Computer History
item.description: Dream Machine § “Behind every great revolution is a vision, and behind one of the greatest revolutions of our time—personal computing—is the vision of J.

item.title: § Tools for Thought
item.description: Welcome to a page on using technology to think and learn more effectively. Let’s start with the basics: What is a tool for thought? Three key questions § I’m focusing on answering three questions: How can LLMs enhance spaced repetition software? How can we solve the public goods problem when developing tools for thought? How do we nudge people to examine what they know instead of defaulting to consuming more content? .

item.title: About
item.description: “The skill of writing is to create a context in which other people can think” — Edwin Schlossberg Thesis § As you peruse, you’ll notice that this isn’t your average blog.
